column1: good length and pushed well down leg side. Sarfraz parries to fine leg with a one-handed dive
good length and pushed across off stump, defended on the front foot
short of a length and pushed wide outside off, tapped into the covers off the back foot
good length and swung away from off stump, sliced on the up to point
good length, swinging away from outside off. Looks to drive on the up and is beaten
good length and shaping away from off stump. Jabs from the crease and gets a thick outside edge to third man
full inswinger coming in at off stump, driven firmly on the up to mid-off
full and wide outside off, some swing away, but nothing bothersome. Follows it with his hands and thumps it wide of mid-off
full and swinging away, wide outside off again. Plenty of room. Reaches out and slices over point
good length and swinging away outside off, skews it to third man off the outside half as he looks to drive on the up
back of a length and in the corridor, left alone
full and swinging down leg side, looks to flick, can't get bat
full inswinger on off stump, driven firmly back at the bowler who fields on the bounce
good length and just outside off, drives on the up with an angled bat. Finds cover
swipes it past square leg. Steps out and doesn't allow it to swing. Reaches it on a good length in front of off stump and swings across the line. Skids off the inside edge to the square leg boundary
full and wide outside off, beaten on the outside edge as he looks to drill this on the up
128kph, short and wide outside off, stands tall and punches on the up between cover and extra cover
good length and angled in at off stump, dropped pitch side into the off side and they steal a single

there it is. The classic Guptill lift over the bowler. It's overpitched on a middle stump line, he brings the full, clean swing from under it and with a full face, sends it sailing over the sightscreen
good length and into the pads, flicked to midwicket on the up
good length and swung away outside off, left alone
outside edge but no second slip in place. There was a fielder there last over, who is now at extra cover. Outswinger from Raees at a length, wafts on the up and he's safe
clears backward point with a powerful swing outside off. Raees bowls a length one with lots of width and he flays this high to Shadab's right
overpitched outside off, drilled gorgeously with a full face but mid-off does superbly to get the dive in to his left and stop that
short of a length just outside off, dabs it in front of point and gets a loud, confident call of yes from Munro
short of a length just outside off, defended on the back foot
whew. Overpitched on middle stump, clears the front leg and crashes it past the non-striker
good length on middle stump, tapped on the up to midwicket's left
offcutter on a length, just outside off. Leans in nicely and pushes into the covers with soft hands
back of a length wide outside off, chopped to point on the up
full inswinger on middle stump, drives straight to mid-on
good length and shaping in at leg stump, bunted on the up to mid-on
short of a length and angled wide outside off. Drives on the up from above waist height and doesn't time it, but it dribbles past extra cover and they pick up three by the time mid-off can reach it
short of a length and slight swing away outside off, defended into the off side
they've stolen a second from third man. Length ball outside off, opens the face and runs it to third man's left. It's not a big ground. Sarfraz unhappy with his fielder
short ball slanted into the body, he stands tall and uses the angle to pull it to the long leg boundary. That's fifty for the opening stand

top edge taken safely by mid-off who pedals backwards. It's a length ball outside off that holds its line. He looks to slog across the line and is not close to the pitch of this. Goes high in the air. Mid-off and mid-on are both under the path of this. Neither of them has called by the looks of it, but the mid-on fielder withdraws and allows Nawaz to complete his catch
back of a length outside off, punched on the up to cover
length ball tossed up on off stump, defended on the front foot
back of a length and in at leg stump, pushed to mid-on from the crease
good length and coming in at middle stump. Straightens and he defends off the outside half
pushes a length ball down leg side and he stands deep in the crease to tickle this fine. Possibly off the thigh guard
good length at off stump, defended on the front foot
good length and pushed in flat on leg stump, defended on the front foot
lovely shot, but he can't beat Raees in his follow through. Short of a length outside off and it's a well-timed punch on the up, full face of the bat, from the back foot
short of a length at off stump, tapped into the covers off the back foot
good length and just outside off, pushed on the up to extra cover
short of a length at off stump, punched back to the bowler on the up
nicely carved. This is a length ball coming into the corridor from around the wicket. Not a lot of room but he uses the wrists to punch between point and cover
good length outside off, opens the face and runs it down to third man
short of a length at off stump, punched to extra cover off the back foot. Fumble from the fielder and a mix up between the batsmen, before they choose not to go through with the run
floated up on a length, wide outside off. Puts in a big stride and caresses this through extra cover
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
good length on leg stump, pushed into the leg side off the inside half as he looks to defend
good length on leg stump, defended into the leg side
good length and in at leg stump, top-edge on the attempted sweep. It lands safely in front of deep square
full and into the pads, plonks the front leg across and clips it wide of mid-on who puts in a dive to his right
good length and nipping into the corridor, defended on the back foot
short of a length just outside off, stands tall and punches to mid-off's right
beaten as he plays completely down the wrong line. Length ball angles in on middle stump and deviates away. He's looking to flick through midwicket as the ball flies over off stump
full and in at off stump, driven solidly to mid-off
good length on the up, pushed on the up to mid-off

short of a length just outside off, waits for it to skid on and chops it between backward point and short third man. The latter gives chase and flicks it back in with a slide as sweeper comes around to help him
good length and spinning away outside off, sliced to point
back of a length at middle stump, driven to long-on off  the back foot
good length, right up at middle stump. Defended on the front foot
short of a length outside off, punched to sweeper's left from under point's dive
loopy length ball on off stump. Steps out and is forced to block it
short of a length at off stump, taps it to point's left with soft hands
good length and wide outside off, shuffles and defends to cover on the front foot
good length outside off, shuffles and defends to point
back of a length outside off, shuffles and stabs away from the body to try and find a single at third man. Beaten
good length and in at off stump, defended on the front foot
good length on middle stump, walks into it as he flicks to deep midwicket
good length on off stump, whipped out to deep midwicket
good length on off stump, defended into the covers
good length at off stump, pushes on the front foot. Inside edge through square leg
back f a length at middle stump, defended on the back foot
tossed up at off stump, driven on the up to mid-off
good length on off stump, stabs to point on the front foot
short of a length outside off, punched on the up to sweeper cover
good length outside off, shuffles and walks into this as he punches and opens the face to get it to sweeper's left
good length outside off, can't get the flick away after shuffling into the off side. Ends up pushing it back towards the bowler
length outside off, shuffles, flicks to deep square's left this time
short of a length just outside off, steered to third man
short of a length outside off, punched forcefully to sweeper cover
tossed up outside off, steps out and pushes straight to extra cover
tossed up outside off, doesn't get to the pitch as he chips this to sweeper's right
back of a length at off stump, pushed to extra cover off the back foot
length on off stump, defended to extra cover
drops it short on an off stump line. Turns away, but Guptill has enough time to go deep in the crease and swat this over midwcket
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
full and wide outside off, reaches out and drives sweetly to sweeper's right
good length at off stump, driven uppishly to extra cover's left. Walked into that and that ball stopped on him
oh beautiful. Short of a length ball with not too much width. But this sits up nicely off the surface and Guptill opens the face to bisect point and short third man
good length and in at off stump, defended on the front foot
back of a length at off stump, defended straight to point
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
whacks it into Williamson's bat. Googly first up, floated up as a full toss and Guptill nails this on-drive. Luckily for Williamson, it deflects to long-off as his bat flies into the midwicket region
tossed up on off stump, driven to extra cover
full outside off, squeezes it out to long-off
length on middle stump, flicked to short fine's left
good length on off stump, dips on him. Reaches out a long way and pushes it through cover. Turn and bounce there
back of a length on off stump, punched to long-on
fullish delivery outside off, coming back into Guptill, who opens the bat face and guides one down to third man

what just happened? Williamson has bunted a catch to deep square leg. A good length delivery on middle and leg, Williamson, it seems, is caught in between a hoick and a flick, in between going after it with everything or just clipping it for one. In the end, he does neither. The ball just lobs to the fielder. Uncharacteristic, strange
good length delivery outside off, pushed to cover from the crease. Here's Pakistan's chance
good length on middle and leg, defended into the midwicket region
full delivery outside off, 122 kph, driven to short cover. A better length to Guptill
125 kph, overpitched outside off, Guptill leans forward and crisply caresses his drive to the sweeper cover
lots of flight from Shadab to start, a tad wide. Taylor strides forward and drives to long-off with the spin

86 kph, ouch! Guptill hits his partner again. Shortish outside off, he rocks back and slaps a pull into Taylor's pads at the opposite end. No time to get out of the way. A laugh and an apology from Guptill
driven back to the bowler, was overpitched
shortens the length, outside off, a hint of turn, pushed back into the off side
just wide of the fielder at point. Shortish and wide, Guptill can't keep his cut down, flashes, gets a thick outside edge which flies away towards point's right.
flight outside off, shortish, left alone
good length on middle and leg, worked away to square leg
that's a poor delivery and put away. On the pads, not very quick, Guptill helps himself to four with a flick through backward square leg. Placed and his power does the rest
ooh, 116 kph, goes wide of the crease, pitches it on a length and the ball jags away to beat the bat. Was it a legcutter?
fullish delivery outside off, defended into the cover region for nothing
this one comes back in, shortish and a bit wide, slashed into the body
a slower delivery outside off, dabbed towards point from the crease
flat delivery on off and middle, Taylor gets low and paddles the ball fine, towards fine leg, for a couple. Nicely done
flight outside off, sliced towards point
worked away to long-on off the overpitched delivery
shortish around off, Taylor goes back and punches to long-on
on middle and leg, looked like the googly, worked to midwicket
a tad short and wide outside off, slashed away to point
117 kph, full delivery around off, worked to midwicket
good length again, around off, defended back
a slower ball, 116 kph. Taylor walks down and works the ball to midwicket.
full delivery around off, defended back
a shortish delivery around off, 116 kph, a thick leading edge towards point
115 kph, a legcutter outside off, full outside off. Guptill plays the line but the ball moves away just enough to beat the bat
83 kph, flight outside off, driven to short cover
83 kph, pushed through but a lovely length, full but not overpitched. Defended into the point region
tossed up, too much flight, driven to the sweeper cover
a thick outside edge races down towards third man. Just enough turn. Hafeez pulls the ball just inside, good stop. Fifty for Guptill
88 kph, full delivery on middle and leg, driven away to long-on
flight outside off, sliced to the point region
85 kph, nicely bowled, slow around off, defended back
84 kph, flight outside off, the ball spins away but Taylor comes down and drives the ball back
87 kph, flat around middle and leg, worked to midwicket
four dots. 84 kph, full on middle, Taylor charges but shovels a flick to midwicket. Good pressure from Pakistan
88 kph, pushed through, flat on middle and leg, nudged to square leg
just one off the over. 'Very well done,' says Sarfraz. Flat on middle and leg, worked away to midwicket
83 kph, lots of flight outside off, carved away to point
quick on middle and leg, 84 kph, clipped to midwicket. Lots of dot balls from Taylor
84 kph, flight outside off, shimmies down and defends to cover. Another one. 10 off 22
flight outside off, a fluid drive to the sweeper cover
81 kph, full outside off, driven to long-off with the spin
short and wide outside off, chopped away towards point. Just two off that over
flat down leg, swept to short fine leg
90 kph, a tad short, and wide, slashed to point from the crease. Another dot
flight on middle and leg, 83 kph, worked to midwicket. Struggling a touch
beats short fine leg for four. Poor line, drifts down leg and Guptill sweeps it fine, short fine leg dives to his right but can't get across
quick on middle and leg, 88 kph, nudged to midwicket
85 kph, some drift on that, full on leg, Taylor comes down and drives to long-on
86 kph, googly around off, punched away to long-on for a single
shortish and a tad wide outside off, left alone
drops it short down leg, Guptill picks the length early, goes back but under-edges the ball to short fine leg
nicely bowled, some flight outside off, defended to point
another dot. Short and wide outside off, slashed to short third man
lots of flight outside off, pushed away to cover
86 kph, flight on off, driven to long-on
83 kph, on middle and leg, defended
Nawaz drifts on the pads again, poor line. An opportunity for Guptill, he gets low and hammers a hard sweep to the deep backward square leg boundary
flight on leg, pushed to long-on
flat outside off, a tad shorter and slower, pushed back to the bowler
chipped away, but falls short of midwicket. Flat delivery on middle and leg, Taylor comes down and works it into the leg side
83 kph, shortish around off, punched away to long-on for a single
83 kph, flight outside off, driven to long-off with the spin. Well played
a bit of drift, on middle and leg, pushed towards cover
short and wide, 84 ks, scythed to point
very slow through the air, good loop, around off, played to point
there is some pressure, Guptill reads the length of a short delivery, goes back and pulls to deep square leg
a good length delivery outside off to start from Ashraf, punched away to point for a run
full delivery outside off, dabbed towards gully for a run
good length delivery again outside off, Guptill stays in the crease and slaps a punch past cover for two. Nicely done
good length on middle and leg, 128 kph, a thick inside edge to short fine leg
133 kph, full delivery on middle and leg, inside-edged to deep square leg for a run
shortish delivery outside off, another punchy push into the off side
82 kph, some flight on middle and leg, pushed back to the bowler
83 kph, overpitched, some flight on leg, driven to long-on
83 kph, flat around middle and leg, defended back
beauty. Tossed up, slightly wide of the crease, draws Taylor forward and then a ripping legbreak leaves Taylor's bat hanging. Keeps his balance
more flight outside off, dabbed to point
a tad short around middle and leg, pulled to deep square leg
133 kph, very nicely played, shortish delivery on middle, Taylor shimmies down and works the ball into the gap at backward square leg. His helmet falls off as he scampers back
a wild swing. Good length delivery outside off, Taylor clears a front leg and swings, the Taylor way, but the ball goes past
full delivery around off, skewed to square leg
133 kph, on a length around off, glided off the open face to point
132 kph, good length delivery on off, nice channel, forces Guptill into a defensive block
full delivery outside off, 132 kph, driven to mid-off for a tight, but good single. Quality call
good length delivery on middle and leg, defended into the off side
shortish delivery on middle and leg, Guptill is early through the pull. May have been pace off the ball too. Hit on the body
on a length, down leg, worked off his hips to deep square leg
129 kph, good length on middle and leg, off the pad towards square leg for a leg bye
a slower delivery on middle and leg, worked away to midwicket from the crease
133 kph, a good single, shortish on off, punched away to mid-off for a single. Another nicely judged single

wow, Faheem has missed a big opportunity. All he needed to do was run to the stumps. Good length delivery outside off, chopped away towards short cover. Guptill calls for one, but is sent back. he slips over and tumbles and is left sprawling mid-pitch. Faheem picks up in his follow-through and misses the stumps at the batsman's end.
on middle and leg, Guptill misses a big swing, struck on the pad, but sliding down
a short delivery outside off, Guptill runs down and slaps the delivery through mid-off. Fantastic execution, probably anticipated that length
good length delivery down leg, nudged away to short fine leg
132 kph, nicely bowled, good length around off, patted away to cover
and smashed for four. 134 kph, full delivery outside off, Guptill runs down, meets the ball as it pitches and nails a drive past mid-off.
135 kph, good length around middle and leg, nudged to midwicket
great batting, 132 kph, a length delivery around off, Taylor stays low and goes from bottom to top, ensuing his paddle scoop went over short fine leg. Clever
134 kph, full delivery around off, defended back
past short fine leg for four more. 132 kph, full delivery outside off, Taylor shovels a flick with plenty of bottom-handed power past the fielder. A hoick
a slower delivery, 114 kph, pushed away to long-on
full delivery outside off, 133 kph, dabbed to point.
short ball outside off stump, pokes it down to third man
full and just outside off, leans in to the drive, finds extra cover
short of a length, wide outside off. Backs away and taps to sweeper cover
drops it short and very wide and Taylor climbs into this. Flays it past point
back of a length and cramping him on off stump. Forces him to push it back down the pitch
short and wide outside off, steps out and stretches a long way to drag this pull to deep square
short ball wide outside off stump, cuts straight to backward point
floated up on middle stump, doesn't get to the pitch and drives against the turn to get this to long-on
tossed up on off stump, pushed with the turn to extra cover
short and spinning away outside off, drags it to deep square with a pull off the toe-end
good length and just outside off. Drops it into the covers and steals the single
short outside off, cut to point
good length and outside off. Backs into the leg side and slices uppishly to third man's right
yorker just outside off, chops it wide of point with an open face
short one climbing above his front shoulder and he can't get the hook away after cramping himself with all the shuffling around
full outside off, drills it straight to mid-off and steals a run
yorker just outside off, jams it out towards mid-off off the toe-end
another yorker. Speared in at middle stump. Can't do more than nudge this into the point area
short and turning away outside off, guides it straight to short third man
waits a little more as this turns away from short of a length outside off. Pushes it to short third man's left but can't beat his dive
loopy full toss on leg stump, flicked to deep square's left
full on leg stump and pushed through quicker. Driven to long-on's right
tossed up on middle stump, driven to long-on
full on leg stump, tapped back to the bowler on the front foot
short outside off, steered to third man after getting on top of the bounce
yorker on leg stump, pushed out to midwicket
slapped away. Drops the slower ball short and it cuts in towards him at chest height. Midwicket is inside. He stands tall and pulls it past him
full toss outside off, holds his shape and punches this well wide of extra cover and sweeper cover to bring up the 200
short one outside off, pulls it on the front foot and gets it to deep square's left
yorker outside off, can't beat extra cover with the drive
good length and wide outside off stump, plonks the front leg across and ramps this to fine leg
short ball on middle stump, controlled pull to deep square
length on off stump, steps out and nudges it to deep midwicket

Taylor survives a run out appeal at the non-striker's end. Guptill pulls to deep square leg's left and they decide to take his throw on. Yamin fires it back to the bowler who underarms it onto the stumps as Taylor slides his bat in
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
dropped short on off stump, swivels and pulls well in front of midwicket on the long boundary. Allows him a lot of time to come back for the second and complete his 13th ODI century
short of a length at off stump, bunted to point's left with soft hands

lobs it to long-on off the toe-end. Full one in the slot at a middle stump line and he looks straightaway to lift it over the leg side. Balls appears to sit in the pitch a touch and that's enough to mess with his timing

short ball outside off, makes room and slices this wide of third man and comes back for the second to complete his fifty. He has now made the record for most 50+ scores in ODIs for New Zealand with 58
full on leg stump, driven to long-on's right
length and slanted across the batsman, driven to sweeper cover on the up
yorker outside off, tapped aggressively into the turf. Can only get it out as far as extra coer
floated up at middle stump, flicked to deep midwicket
good length and in at leg stump. Leans in and taps this into the vacant midwicket area
back of a length on off stump, tickled into the midwicket region with a closed face
good length and following the batsman down leg side. Flicked to deep midwicket
good length and in at leg stump. Pokes it through midwicket and this time the bowler can't prevent the second
full and slanted in at leg stump. Shuffles across and yorks himself as he looks to flick. Deflected to short fine's right off the pad. LBW appeal is turned down
low full toss outside off, flicked between deep midwicket and long-on
full toss just outside off, punched to sweeper's right
slower ball dropped short outside off. Cuts it hard and can't beat point's dive to the left
yorker on off stump, can only squeeze this out to point
slower ball taken on the full, driven to long-on
low full toss at off stump. Driven inside-out to long-off's right
nails the yorker first up, just outside off. Can't get bat on it

paddles it onto the stumps. Full ball dipping in at off stump. Gets low to try and run this past short fine with a ramp but he ends up getting beside the ball and getting it off the inside half of the bat, into middle stump
short ball climbing across the corridor. Looks to steer it with the angle, beaten
short ball just outside off, carved uppishly to sweeper cover
low full toss into the pads down leg side. Fine leg is in. This is too easy for CDG. Flicks it to the long leg boundary
yorker on off stump, jammed out to point
full and into leg stump, driven to deep midwicket

Zaman takes a nice catch at deep square. Length ball is angled in at Nicholls who swipes cleanly on the up. It's flat and flying away from Zaman at deep square but he keeps his eyes on it and follows nicely with his arms to pouch it at waist height
yorker on off stump, jams it back to the bowler

run out chance missed as Raees can't hit the stumps with his underarm flick. CDG jams the yorker into the crease and they take off for a run. Raees is bowling around the wicket so his approach to the ball is leading with his weaker arm. Flicks as he dives but can't find the stumps. Would have been out
length and just outside off, driven on the up to extra cover
low full toss dipping in at leg stump, looks to drive it straight, can't beat the bowler
low full toss on leg stump, punched to long-on
short of a length ball skidding quickly across the corridor. Latham looks to pull and is beaten on the inside edge
length ball wide outside off, walks across and swipes across the line to make deep square sprint to his right

seems to be a big edge as Latham improvises on the ramp and tries to hit it wide of the keeper. It's been reviewed, the umpire has given it not out. He shapes to scoop this fine but is forced to adjust and open the face as this full ball is slanted across him. Gets a thin edge through to Sarfraz. Review confirms the wicket

looks like Santner could be run out first ball. Yes he is. Gets a short ball going across him. It's skidding fast as he pulls and he chips it wide of long-on off the high part of the bat. This mistimed shot allows them a thought about the second run - which CDG calls for and is close to completing. Nawaz fires the throw to the striker's end on the bounce. Sarfraz picks up and beats Santner's dive by a long way
short and into the chest. Can't do more than push this back down the pitch
yorker in at middle stump, jumps across to the off side and bunts this to deep square
short ball surprises him as he walks down the pitch. Climbs past his belated attempt at an upper cut
slower ball, full and wide outside off. Checks his shot and pokes into the covers for the single
misses his length and gets punished. Overpitched ball on off stump and he stands tall to pummel this over the umpire
slower ball, dug short and very wide. He picks it but can't get the timing right as he looks to slash this over short third man
yorker across off stump, hangs deep and jams it to third man's right
nails the yorker at middle stump. Southee manages to squeeze it past the non-striker and they come back for the second
slower ball dropped short of a length outside off,drags it out to deep midwicket with a pull

uff you brave man Faheem. Attempts a catch as De Grandhomme slaughters this overpitched ball straight back at him. It's about shin height and he puts both hands down at it in his follow through. Nowhere near catching it, but that is brave. He's really hurt himself though...
yorker on middle stump, pushed out to extra cover
short ball wide outside off, carves it to sweeper's left
misses the yorker length on a middle stump line and Southee clears his front leg to swat this across the line. Gets it between long-on and deep midwicket and into the boundary on the bounce
low full toss outside off, backs away and looks to scythe this square. Big outside edge. Third man runs to his left and fields...and unleashes a throw that ends up in midwicket and gives them a third
lovely. Southee walks across to the off side and Yamin goes for his toes. He can't get any connection on this yorker
yorker outside off, walks into the off side again and plays a half-lap shot into the leg side. Finds square leg
full one wide outside off, driven to long-off with the toe-end
Umar Amin nearly pulls off a blinder at deep midwicket. Flies to his left and gets two hands on this but he can't hang on. Low full toss on middle stump and it's chipped to his left at deep midwicket

an easy run out chance missed as Yamin fails to collect the ball at the non-striker's end. It's in the blockhole, he can only bunt it towards long-on and the throw comes back on the bounce as they attempt the second. He has plenty of time but he grabs at it and fumbles a few times. Ball's not in his hand as he breaks the stumps
full and straight to begin, a hint of inward movement, worked away to midwicket
full and wide from Southee, a bit too wide. Zaman throws his hands at it and caresses the ball to cover point. Have to hit the gaps for bad balls
134 kph, nice and full, seeing if there is some swing, carved away to point from the crease
a shortish delivery outside off, Zaman thinks about cutting but decides against it
a full delivery around off, a hint of inward movement, driven to cover with his feet rooted in the crease
134 kph, charges at Southee, full delivery swings back in, flicked down to fine leg for the first run of the innings
136 kph, full delivery, swinging back in. Zaman falls over a flick, struck on the pad
a tad wider outside off, on a length, carved away to cover. Not timed very well
139 kph, short and wide outside off, slashed to cover
smashed him on the helmet! Well-directed bouncer on middle and leg, Zaman takes his eyes off the ball, drops his hands and takes the blow. Lobs to the keeper

Munro drops an easy one. Yikes, an absolute sitter is put down at square leg. Follows up an excellent bouncer with another well-directed short ball, pulled away with bad timing to Munro's right, he gets across but the ball just hits the thumb and ricochets away. His hands were in a terrible position
full on middle and leg, defended
good run. Full delivery outside off, pushed to mid-off for a single. Nice, early call
goes after the pull, but gets lots of power behind it, even with bad timing. Just enough bat to clear short midwicket and over, four. Hitting that hard length to Zaman
137 kph, on the pads, nudged down to fine leg
another good single. Short on middle and leg, clipped to square leg
goes short again does Southee, another bouncer. Zaman lets the ball come to him and then pulls through backward square leg. Rolled his wrists on the ball
136 kph, full and straight, pushed to mid-on with the angle of swing. Just the one dot ball in that over
well bowled, generating good pace, 141 kph, full on middle and leg, swings back in late, a thick inside edge to square leg

edged and taken this time. 142 kph, full delivery outside off. Amin drives with his hands well way from the body, and the ball hardly moves. Finds the outside edge and carries low to Taylor at wide slip, straight inside. Quality catch. Henry's extra pace meant Amin's feet weren't where it should have been
excellent start to Azam, full and straight, driven away to mid-on
good length delivery outside off, beaten on the outside edge
140 kph, excellent bowling. Hits a good length and generates a bit of seam movement away, beats the bat again. Harrying him for pace
short on middle and leg, off the pad towards square leg. Clearly troubled for pace
136 kph, excellent bowling, goes fuller outside off, not much movement, left alone
133 kph, full delivery outside off, defended into the off side. This is where Pakistan get into so much trouble, 0 off 6 for Azam, not one ball he has looked to score
that's a poor delivery and he puts it away. Much more like it, on the pads and Azam picks him off through square leg. That's where you don't want to be. Nice timing
full outside off, 139 kph, left alone watchfully
shortish and a tad wide outside off, punched away to backward point
full delivery outside off, coming back in, played towards point

Henry strikes again, and Pakistan's struggles continue. It was full outside off, Zaman clears his front leg, his back foot moves nowhere. All he does is chip a catch to mid-off. That's a terrible stroke, not sure what he was trying to do, go over cover or hit it along the ground.
a wide yorker outside off, jammed down to third man

that's lovely from Azam. Let the ball come to him, on the pads, and he clipped it away through midwicket with nonchalant ease. Just seems like a shot practiced over and over. He'll put it away more than 85% of the time
139 kph, full delivery outside off, driven to mid-on
139 kph, good length delivery outside off, opens the bat face and guides it to third man for a run
134 kph, good leave, full outside off, invites the drive, but Azam not biting
136 kph, too straight again, worked away to square leg
short and wide from Southee, slashed down to third man
nicely played, overpitched outside off. Sohail leans forward and slices his drive through backward point. Good running from the batsmen and the fielders in tandem
137 kph, on a length around off, pushed away to mid-on
a full and wide delivery, deemed too wide for legality.
136 kph, full delivery outside off, pushed back to the bowler, who fields in his follow-through
137 kph, full and wide outside off, no stroke
nicely driven to mid-off for a single. Williamson gets across but fails to pick up cleanly as he swoops on the ball
dug in, short on off and middle, Azam ducks

140 kph, edged and another one. Henry on a roll. But not much Azam could do about that. Fantastic bowling. Full length outside off, fifth-stump channel, the ball moves away late. Takes the thick outside edge to second slip. No trouble at all. All down to Henry's pace again, Azam a fraction of a second later to the ball
139 kph, short delivery outside off, excellent length, Hafeez sways out of the line
140 kph, good length outside off, defended away into the cover region
134 kph, slower delivery? Angled away from the batsman, full delivery outside off, the ball seams away late and beats the bat. Another terrific delivery
full delivery outside off, 132 kph, pushed to point
a thick outside edge, full and wide. Sohail gets a thick outside edge down to third man
136 kph, full delivery around off, defended back
a nice short delivery outside off, Hafeez looks to pull, but the ball goes over the bat. Beaten for pace again
goes wide of the crease, full delivery, 134 kph, pushed to mid-off
136 kph, good length outside off, dabbed off the open face to point
141 kph, full outside off, probing channels, defended to point
a good change in length, dug in short around middle and leg, Haris gets underneath
136 kph, good length delivery outside off, defended to cover
full outside off, drilled to mid-off. Five dots. Too many from Pakistan
goes through point, Nicholls. Shortish delivery outside off, patted away towards point, but the ball may have kept a touch low and scooted across
124 kph, on the pads from CdG, flicked away to square leg. Would you like it anywhere else? Hafeez picks out the fielder
full and wide outside off, driven to mid-off
and again. 124 kph, this is not very good batting. On the pads and Hafeez picks out square leg. Missed out on eight runs
121 kph, full outside off, inside-halved towards midwicket. Four dots
five dot balls. Another overpitched delivery outside off, driven neatly to mid-off, but his placement isn't great
126 kph, good single, but just one off the over. Another overpitched delivery, pushed away to mid-off
a short delivery drifts down leg for a wide
fine stop at point. Shortish delivery outside off, punched very nicely towards point, on top of the bounce, but Nicholls dives to his right to save three. Excellent cricket
hitting that hard length, short outside off, slashed to point.
nicely played from Sohail, too full outside off, driven through mid-off with good timing. Just a punchy stroke, not over-hitting, plenty of pace on the ball already
Ferguson's response is a bouncer on leg, Haris ducks early and easily
143 kph, good length on middle and leg, nudged away to mid-on for one, well run
another bouncer, on middle and leg, pulled to square leg, very badly timed, an indicator that he was very late on the stroke
123 kph, full delivery outside off, left alone
full delivery outside off, sliced off the outside half towards point
another lovely shot, overpitched on off, Haris brings the bat down at a straight angle and drills it past mid-on and the bowler for four. Beautiful
shortish outside off, under-edged towards square leg for one
on the pads again, Hafeez misses a flick, struck on the pad. But they steal a leg bye to short fine leg
full delivery outside off, 124 kph, blocked to point
timed away for four. Full outside off, Hafeez strides forward and caresses a drive past cover for four. Sublime timing
good length outside off, 146 kph, sliced to point
full and wide outside off, 148 kph, Hafeez throws his hands at the ball but makes no contact, beaten
144 kph, short delivery on middle and leg, clipped to square leg
hurrying Hafeez up again, short around off, dabbed into the off side

picks out Munro at extra cover, who gets his hands in a good position and takes the catch! He's delighted. A short and wide delivery from Ferguson there, plenty of width on it. Hafeez gets into a good position to punch, but fails to keep the ball down, goes through with a waft in the air and it's straight to the fielder. Another poor shot.
back of a length and slanted across off stump, punched square on the off side but Guptill's big reach to his left at point denies him
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
good length on middle stump, pushed to midwicket's left for a quick run
good length on off stump, defended into the off side
good length on middle stump, defended to mid-on
back of a length outside off, defended off the back foot
nearly plays on. Short ball climbing up in a corridor line. Jumps up and stabs at it without getting behind it. It bounces past leg stump
back of a length on off stump, defended on the back foot
short of a length outside off, dabbed to third man
short ball into the ribs, defended off the back foot
good length and in at off stump, driven back down the pitch and Lockie dives to his left to to stop it
bouncer outside off has him jumping. Can't get bat on it
good length and in at leg stump, shovelled wide of mid-on on the up
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
good length on off stump, driven on the up to mid-off
length on leg stump, clipped to deep square
good length and in at middle stump. Tapped to mid-on
plucked at midwicket! Taylor stretches high to his right and latches onto this hoick from Sarfraz. He stepped out and dragged this from outside off with a slog, but Taylor takes a sharp on
back of a length at off stump, defended to point
flings thisfar down leg side. Was looking for the yorker, but this slips out
full and down leg side again
low full toss down leg side, leans into this and flicks aerially through square leg
good length and in at middle stump, solidly blocked from the crease
full and just outside off stump, driven to extra cover on the up
angled into the pads on a good length, flicked to fine leg
full outside off, gets a thick edge to third man as he drives away from the body
good length and into the pads. Tickles it fine from the crease
good length and in at of stump, defended off the back foot
back of a length in the corridor, punched to extra cover off the back foot
good length and in at off stump, dabs it wide of point off the outside half
good length on off stump, defended to mid-on off the front foot
full and down leg side. Shuffles and misses the flick
back of a length just outside off, opens the face and guides it to third man
full on middle stump, can't beat the bowler's dive to his left wiht the drive
good length on off stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
drifted in at leg stump, spins and takes the outside half of the bat as he looks to defend
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
full at off stump, driven back to the bowler
floated up at off stump on a good length. Opens the face and pushes it though point on the front foot
a full delivery outside off is driven back to the bowler. A hint of seam movement back in
full around off, 122 kph, jammed away to cover
sweetly-timed but just one. Overpitched delivery outside off, driven wide of mid-off, to his right
a bit wide outside off, glided off the open face for a run to third man
that will help. 122 kph, on middle and leg. Shadab bunts the ball away through wide mid-on. Fantastic timing. Even a diving Southee can't get close to his right
full delivery outside off, chopped away to point
back of a length on middle stump, flicked to deep square
back of a length just outside off, pushed to point with the turn
short and just outside off, punched towards backward point who misses with a dive to the right
tossed up on off stump, driven to long-off
good length and spinning into leg stump, flicked to deep square
length ball pushed flat on leg stump, defended off the back foot
good length on middle stump, a classy drive on he up to mid-on's right but he can't beat Southee's dive
good length on off stump, tapped to mid-off on the up
offcutter, good length on off stump. Defended to point on the front foot
back of a length on middle stump, clipped to deep square
back of a length on middle stump, punched to long-on off the back foot
back of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
good length on off stump, defended to cover on the front foot
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
just clears cover with a drive. This was dipping on him at an off stump line, he was looking to go inside-out
knuckle ball, in at middle stump on a length. Pushed to midwicket off the back foot
full on off stump, driven to long-off
length on middl stump, defended to midwicket
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
classy shot. Pulls this short ball from off stump, in front of deep square leg
short ball on off stump, defended to point off the back foot
good length just outside off, late on the attempted push through cover
short ball at the ribs, jams it into the turf off the back foot
back of a length at off stump, defended off the back foot
full on middle stump, driven to long-off
tossed up outside off, driven straight to extra cover
good length on middle stump, flicks it past deep midwicket
beaten in flight and the ball rolls away to short third man off the back thigh. He was leaning in to drive into the leg side, but this grips and turns away
full at off stump, driven to mid-off
full on leg stump, gets a top edge as he looks to sweep. Can't beat deep square to his right
slower ball on a good length at middle stump, defended on the front foot
short of a length outside off, steered to third man
slower ball, full outside off stump. Slices it to sweeper cover on the front foot
back of a length in the corridor, chopped to third man
back of a length in the corridor, defended into the off side
short of a length outside off, chopped to third man
good length on middle stump, defended on the front foot
tossed up on middle stump, defended on the front foot
short of a length knuckle ball outside off, punched to sweeper cover
floated up at leg stump, steps out and taps to long-on
top edge and into the grille as he looks to sweep. It was a length ball on middle stump, dipping on him
back of a length on off stump, defended off the back foot
short of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover off the back foot
good length and in at off stump, defefended on the back foot
back of a length just outside off, sliced to third man with an open face
short ball angled wide outside off. Stretches across and misses by a long way, because it was wide. It isn't called though
short of a length on middle stump, dabbed to square leg
steep bouncer on a middle stump line has him swaying into the leg side to let this go
good length on leg stump, pushed to long-on, from the front foot
back of a length on middle stump, defended off the back foot
chips as he looks to go inside out. Once again, he doesn't get to the pitch on middle stump. Goes in sweeper's direction but falls short
tossed up at middle stump, driven to log-on
shot. Goes deep in the crease against this short ball on middle and swipes it away to the leg side, wide of long-on
tossed up on off stump, driven back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, jabbed to point off the back foot
short of a length and angled across the corridor, sliced to third man
short ball on off stump, defended off the back foot
bouncer sails down leg side, he can't get bat on it
another bouncer slanted down leg side
lbw appeal is turned down. They won't review. This length ball skids in sharply and strikes on the back thigh in front of leg stump. Might have been going down leg, might have been going above
full just outside off, drives with no feet and gets an inside edge onto boot
short and wide outside off, slapped ferociously to sweeper cover
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
good length and in the corridor, closes the face on it to tap to midwicket
short ball on the hips, wristy tuck to fine leg
bouncer dips in at his chest, he arches into the leg side and lets it pass
length ball wide outside off, hands his bat at it and gets a thick outside edge to third man
back of a length in the corridor, chopped to point's right
good length on leg stump, steps out and flicks straight to midwicket
good length on leg stump, clipped to fine leg
good length and in at middle stump. Keeps low. Pushed back to the bowler
short and wide outside off, cut to sweeper cover
good length on middle stump, punched to mid-off and they steal a single

outside edge evades Nicholls at short third man. Length ball outside off, looks to punch it hard and loses his shape. Head's falling, bat is far away from the body, but there's enough on this to take it over the fielder
138 kph, on the pads, worked away to deep square leg for a single
short and wide, Shadab was waiting for that, went back and slashed a cut to deep point
134 kph, opens the bat face and guides it down to third man.
132 kph, a well-directed bouncer, helped along to fine leg. Shadab took his eyes off the ball
superb bouncer, 134 kph, this has more oomph and is at the neck. Haris sways out of the way nicely
opens the bat face and guides one run down to third man. Decent over for New Zealand
a slower delivery outside off, driven nicely through mid-off. Long-on runs around to his right to clean up. A well-compiled fifty for Haris
slower delivery outside off, driven away to wide mid-off for a single
swatted away for four over midwicket. Runs down to the pitch, but de Grandhomme bowls a short, slow ball. Shadab hits it over the fielder in the circle
108 kph, another short delivery outside off, pulled to long-on
on the pads, worked away to deep square leg
a legcutter at 100 kph outside off, punched to cover
good length outside off, hit to cover from the crease
nice lines, 137 kph, full and straight, driven back to the bowler
very nicely played. 134 kph, short outside off, Haris opens the bat face ever so late and plays it through second slip, instead of gully. Goes so fine and four
pulled just inside the boundary. Short around off, Haris gives himself some room and swats a pull over mid-on. De Grandhomme hunts it down just inside
that's four more. A full delivery outside off, Haris drives with his feet in the crease, but his timing is excellent. Williamson, at mid-off, dives to his left but can't haul it in
136 kph, full delivery around off, driven to mid-off
141 kph, on a length around middle, nudged to midwicket
another dot, back of a length on a fourth-stump channel, guided to point

fifty for Shadab too. Superb batting, amazing fight from these two. Another short delivery outside off, he arches his back and dabs the ball through gully for four. Races away, third man has no chance

out with a direct hit. But Southee misses at the batsman's end. Full delivery outside off, driven away to cover. Shadab is sent back late, Southee picks up, tuens around but misses and concedes an overthrow
clever use of the short ball, dug in around off, Shadab ducks underneath
a low full toss, follows Haris, worked to midwicket

that increasing asking rate has resulted in a wicket. Nicely tossed up from Santner, down leg, 77 kph after a 96 kph first delivery. Haris comes down, but is deceived by that lack of pace as he tries to loft the ball straight. Santner's direction of spin means the ball was always going to skew away to long-on if he didn't time it, as is the case here. But a lovely rearguard effort from Haris
85 kph, flight outside off, driven to cover
another dot ball, 87 kph, lots of flight outside off, hit neatly with the spin to cover
five dot balls. This is flatter and quicker and straighter, pushed back to the bowler
91 kph, superb over, just one off it. Full outside off, dabbed in front of point for one
140 kph, another clever bouncer, dug in but not too high, earns himself a dot ball as Shadab ducks
143 kph, short and wide outside off, chopped to point
145 kph, three dot balls on the bounce. Straight on a length, patted away to point. Required rate close to 10 now
147 kph, a low full toss outside off, driven to mid-off for a single
full on off, 145 kph, Faheem solidly behind the line to defend. Can't be playing defensive blocks at this time, even if it's your first ball, at least look for a single even if you don't get it
146 kph, strays down leg with pace. Beats Ashraf's flick and Latham's dive to his right so five extras
that's better from Ashraf, gets on top of the bounce and dabs a cut to third man
the carrom delivery, short down leg, nudged to square leg
god stop in his follow-through, flat outside off, slapped back. Santner dives to his left

is that the game? It's another lovely display of defensive, but attacking spin bowling. He knows Shadab is going to come so he tosses it up, but wide outside off. Shadab runs down, looking to hit the ball over cover. Instead, it skews off the outside half to short third man. Just like how de Grandhomme got out to Chahal in the second ODI in Pune last year. It's a defensive attacking option, oxymoron-ish as it may be
flight outside off, driven to deep cover
flat down leg, defended back to the bowler
82 kph, excellent over, flat outside off, spinning back in, beats Ashraf on the inside edge and hits him on the pad.
good length down leg, goes for the hoick does Yamin, but the top edge lands safely near third man
116 kph, short and wide, slapped to cover. Pressure on Ashraf, who is on 2 off 6
on the bounce to fine leg, a slower bouncer down leg. Ashraf can't help himself from playing the shot, lobs towards the fielder
118 kph, full outside off, swatted to midwicket. The required rate increasing rapidly
103 kph, another short slower ball is clattered to deep midwicket for one
that's big. A slower delivery in the arc, Ashraf clears his front leg and swings with fierce power, way over square leg. All power
77 kph, excellent again, very slow and very wide. Beats Yamin's sweep
short and wide, scythed to point
shortish and a tad wide, carved to deep point for one. All along the ground
short and wide outside off, Ahsraf stays back and slices his cut behind square on the off side. Played that nicely
the carrom ball down leg, nudged to short fine leg
not one delivery in that over was full, disallowing the batsmen to get underneath the length. How bowling has improvised in the T20 days. Short outside off, swatted to long-on for one
it's short and wide from Henry, under-edged past the keeper for four. This is getting tight
shortish delivery on off, beaten for pace as he under-edges it away into the leg side
edged away for four more. Full and wide from Henry, Ashraf swings hard but only manages a well-placed thick outside edge which races away to the third man fence
good delivery. A short delivery outside off, on off. Sways
another short delivery, Ashraf was waiting for that. Goes from bottom to top and lifts the ball over the fine leg fence. Exceptional shot.
134 kph, a wide yorker outside off, sliced past point for a run to deep third man

Southee takes a good catch and Ashraf goes. Santner atypically tosses this one up. Sees an opportunity, maybe a bit too eager as he swings and all Ashraf can do is get a thick leading edge on his slog sweep. Midwicket runs around to his right, keeps his eyes on the ball and takes it. Good cameo though
slow around off, Yamin gets forward and blocks. Hmm.
runs down but it's fired in, Yamin jams out a drive back to the bowler
short and a tad wide outside off, slashed to deep point
the carrom delivery outside off, tapped to point, one more
nailed. Gives it some air, around off, Yamin gets underneath the length and gives it all he has, and it's more than enough as the slog sweep soars over deep midwicket. Fantastic timing
139 kph, good length delivery outside off, Nawaz drills a drive to mid-off
132 kph. a slower bouncer around off, Nawaz gets underneath
six more. On middle and leg, full delivery. Nawaz clears his front leg and heaves the ball over the boundary at deep midwicket. The boundaries are coming
and there's one more. Full delivery outside off, drilled through mid-off with immense power. Williamson can only watch it go by
over midwicket for a couple. A shorter delivery around off, Nawaz clears his front leg and mis-times his hoick
145 kph, and four more. Very interesting game. A low full toss outside off, dabbed past the keeper for four. Very cleverly played
130 kph, a superb yorker on middle, jammed out.
excellent bowling again, a yorker outside off is squeezed to cover
shortish delivery on middle and leg, swatted away to deep midwicket for one
133 kph, full and straight, skewed into the leg side
129 kph, short down leg, a very poor delivery from Southee. Nawaz just calmly pulls over short fine leg. Lands just inside the boundary.
a low full toss outside off, a thick inside edge on his hoick to short fine leg
117 kph, the swerving slower ball outside off, deceived Nawaz for the lack of pace, goes past the outside edge
another sensational slower ball, back of the hand, but called a wide, went over the batsman's head but the leg umpire calls it

beaten for pace, raw pace. After two slower deliveries, out comes Ferguson's quick, straight delivery. And Nawaz can't adjust. Full on middle and off, Nawaz swings but misses, very late on the ball. The ball hits the stumps
strays down leg, worked away to short fine leg for one
another terrific slower delivery, the batsman has no idea of the pace or bounce. Plays waaay over the ball, beaten
another slower ball down leg, but it's too high again
full delivery outside off, chipped to cover, on the bounce. Southee had an opportunity for a run-out but misses at the bowler's end
106 kph, another slower delivery around off, watches it onto his bat, played towards short fine leg but Yamin refuses the run
an excellent yorker on off and middle, jammed out into the leg side.
130 kph, that's a handy hit. Full on leg, Yamin backs away and drills a drive through long-on. Enough power and pretty good timing
two leg byes. A low full toss down leg, Yamin misses a hoick, off the pad to fine leg
132 kph, a low full toss is jammed out to square leg. Just the one this time
131 kph, beautifully placed. A sensational yorker again, on middle and leg. Raees is late on the ball but gets just enough bat, a thin under edge past the stumps and for four to fine leg.
another straight yorker, kept out somehow.
another thick inside edge to the fine leg boundary. How has he found just that little gap through the stumps and his body? A wild swing off a full delivery results in another boundary
a well-delivered slower ball outside off, Yamin can't make contact with a pull
126 kph, short and wide outside off, carved away behind point. He races back for the second and makes it with a full-length dive.
a short slower ball on middle and leg, 130 kph, pulled to deep midwicket. Just the one
a short slower ball down leg, Raees misses a hoick, struck on the body and lobs towards the keeper. Gets much tougher now

and that's the game. It doesn't go to the last over, but that was a sensational finish to the ODI series. A short slower delivery outside off, Raees swats it away towards midwicket, who keeps his eyes on the ball and takes a reverse-cupped catch. New Zealand complete a 5-0 sweep in the ODIs
